properties.abstract:
The Aarbiwak is a secluded and comfortable high mountain hut in the middle of a wide glacial bowl at the foot of the Finsteraarhorn Ostwand.
The first bivouac was swept away by a storm in winter 1974/1975. but it was rebuilt in 1977. It is owned by the SAC section Pilatus, sleeps up to 17 and has basic cooking facilities like pots and pans - cookers and gas cartridges you will need to take with you! It also has REGA radio for distress calls.

The hut path is one of the longest in the Bernese Alps and leads from the Grimsel Hospiz over three glaciers: the Unteraar and Finsteraar glaciers and the Strahleggfirn. The Aarbiwak is the starting point for demanding alpine ascents of the Lauteraarhorn, Finsteraarhorn or Studerhorn, for a crossing of the Strahleggpass to the (partly marked), the Finsteraarjoch and the Agassizjoch.
properties.subtitle: The long route to the Aarbiwak
properties.title: From the Grimselhospiz

sac_photos.title: Now head south-west in the direction of this photo.
The beautiful landscape beside the Grimselstausee.
At the source of the Aare, the glacier forefield of the Unteraargletscher.
The glacier forefield of the Unteraargletscher.

segments.description: From the Postauto/ bus stop at the Grimselhospiz take the steps down onto the dam. Cross this, climb back up and pass through a tunnel. Now trace the north side of the reservoir towards the valley at the northeastern end of the reservoir; 1 to 1 Â½ hours. Cross the glacier forefield onto the scree-covered Unteraar glacier ca. 1980 m.
segments.title: Grimsel Hospiz 1980 m to the tongue of the Unteraargletschers ca. 1980 m

segments.description: The path from the glacier's tongue over the Unteraar glacier changes from year to year. In the best case, you can climb directly over the tongue of the Unteraar Glacier. But this has not been easy in recent years (as of 2017). In fact, it has been better to start up the path to the LauteraarhÃ¼tte (well marked) to bypass the lowest part of the Unteraar Glacier on the right (north). Once the large central moraine is reached, follow this along the glacier's northern shore. At the broad glacial junction continue in a south-westerly direction onto the Finsteraarglatscher (from about 2500m you may find markings). At the confluence of the Strahlegg glacier turn to the right (northwest) and walk 500 m before leaving the glacier at around 2700 m (crevasses). Now climb moraine scree directly up to the bivouac

photos.caption: Having arrived on the central moraine, the hardest part is over.
The glacial junction head south-west onto the Finsteraargletscher (in the direction of this photo)

photo.image_usage: Beim Abschwung wechselt man vom Unteraar- auf dem Finsteraargletscher.

photos.caption: The magnificent Finsteraarhorn. From here on keep an eye out for blue-white marked iron rods.
Northwest onto the Strahleggfirn for a short time.

segments.title: From the tongue of the  Unteraargletschers ca. 1980m to Aarbiwak 2733m
